Extracting a dataset about of climate variables in Lis

Antony Barja

2021-03-14

Source: vignettes/lis_extract.Rmd
lis_extract.Rmd

In this vignettes you might to learn like to use some functions about of the Malaria Hydrobasin project to extract a dataset about of climate variables.

The main functions are:

  • get_climate
  • get_etp
  • get_ghm
  • get_pop
  • get_urban
  • get_ndvi
  • get_evi
  • get_savi
  • get_ndvi

This functions taking some dataset of Google Earth Engine, this are of next:

Categoría Variable Resolución espaciales Año Fuente
Climática Precipitación 5 x 5 km 1981 – 2020 Funk, Chris, Pete Peterson, Martin Landsfeld, Diego Pedreros, James Verdin, Shraddhanand Shukla, Gregory Husak, James Rowland, Laura Harrison, Andrew Hoell & Joel Michaelsen. “The climate hazards infrared precipitation with stations—a new environmental record for monitoring extremes”. Scientific Data 2, 150066. doi:10.1038/sdata.2015.66 2015.
Climática Temperatura superficial 1 x 1 km 2000-2021 Wan, Z., Hook, S., Hulley, G. (2015). MOD11A2 MODIS/Terra Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity 8-Day L3 Global 1km SIN Grid V006 [Data set]. NASA EOSDIS Land Processes DAAC. Accessed 2021-01-24 from https://doi.org/10.5067/MODIS/MOD11A2.006
Climática Escorrentía 5 x 5 km 1958 – 2019 Abatzoglou, J.T., S.Z. Dobrowski, S.A. Parks, K.C. Hegewisch, 2018, Terraclimate, a high-resolution global dataset of monthly climate and climatic water balance from 1958-2015, Scientific Data 5:170191, doi:10.1038/sdata.2017.191
Climática Humedad del suelo 5 x 5 km 1958 – 2019 Abatzoglou, J.T., S.Z. Dobrowski, S.A. Parks, K.C. Hegewisch, 2018, Terraclimate, a high-resolution global dataset of monthly climate and climatic water balance from 1958-2015, Scientific Data 5:170191, doi:10.1038/sdata.2017.191
Climática Evapotranspiración 500 x 500 m 2001 – 2021 Running, S., Mu, Q., Zhao, M. (2017). MOD16A2 MODIS/Terra Net Evapotranspiration 8-Day L4 Global 500m SIN Grid V006 [Data set]. NASA EOSDIS Land Processes DAAC. Accessed 2021-01-24 from https://doi.org/10.5067/MODIS/MOD16A2.006
Ambiental NDVI 250 x 250 m 2000-2021 Didan, K. (2015). MOD13Q1 MODIS/Terra Vegetation Indices 16-Day L3 Global 250m SIN Grid V006 [Data set]
Ambiental EVI 250 x 250 m 2000-2021 Didan, K. (2015). MOD13Q1 MODIS/Terra Vegetation Indices 16-Day L3 Global 250m SIN Grid V006 [Data set]
Ambiental SAVI 250 x 250 m 2000-2021 Didan, K. (2015). MOD13Q1 MODIS/Terra Vegetation Indices 16-Day L3 Global 250m SIN Grid V006 [Data set]
Antrópico Consolidado Urbano 500 x 500 m 2001 – 2019 Friedl, M., Sulla-Menashe, D. (2019). <i>MCD12Q1 MODIS/Terra+Aqua Land Cover Type Yearly L3 Global 500m SIN Grid V006</i> [Data set]. NASA EOSDIS Land Processes DAAC. Accessed 2021-01-24 from https://doi.org/10.5067/MODIS/MCD12Q1.006
Antrópico WorldPop 100 x 100 m 2000 – 2020 Americas population data: Alessandro Sorichetta, Graeme M. Hornby, Forrest R. Stevens, Andrea E. Gaughan, Catherine Linard, Andrew J. Tatem, 2015, High-resolution gridded population datasets for Latin America and the Caribbean in 2010, 2015, and 2020, Scientific Data, doi:10.1038/sdata.2015.45

Remember that you can use this functions only if you have a count in Google Earth Engine, if you don’t have a count , you could register in this link

Extract dataset about climate

In this case we going to use the function get_climate, the first step is install the packages lis, rgee and tidyverse.

The first step is active your count of Google Earth Engine using the function ee_Initialize()


library(lis)
library(rgee)
library(sf)
library(tidyverse)
library(leaflet)
library(cptcity)
ee_Initialize()
#> ── rgee 1.0.8 ─────────────────────────────────────── earthengine-api 0.1.252 ── 
#>  ✓ email: not_defined
#>  ✓ Initializing Google Earth Engine:
 ✓ Initializing Google Earth Engine:  DONE!
#> 
 ✓ Earth Engine user: users/antonybarja8 
#> ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

To extract the data set is necessary to have an objective polygon

amazonas <- import_db('Peru_shp') %>% 
  filter(reg == 'AMAZONAS') %>% 
  select(distr)
amazonas_ro <- getClimate(year = 2019,
                          bands = 'ro',
                          region = amazonas,
                          fun = 'mean') 
#> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'geojsonsf':
#>   method        from   
#>   print.geojson geojson
#> [1] "Extracting information [0/84]..."
#> The image scale is set to 1000.
head(amazonas_ro)
